channel.title: Jean Crowder
channel.description: Recent news about Jean Crowder, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Mentioned by Cowichan Valley Citizen
item.description:
UPDATED: Conservatives leaving local MP off guest list to riding events
Nanaimo-Cowichan MP Jean Crowder doesn't want to join the Conservative Party, but she sure wouldn't mind being invited to the party when the federal government makes funding announcements in her riding. Last week Conservative MP John Duncan (North Island) was in town to make two federal funding announcements and Crowder, the Government of Canada's official member of Parliament for the area, was left off the guest list both times. "In the first couple years after I was elected I did get invitations to these ...

item.title: Mentioned by Nanaimo Daily News
item.description:
Davies says MPs should be sitting in House
Nanaimo-Cowichan MP Jean Crowder played host to a group of 10 fellow New Democrats from the province, including Libby Davies, the NDP's deputy leader, and Fin Donnelly, the party's B.C. caucus chairman. Nathan Cullen, MP for Skeena-Bulkley Valley, ...

item.title: Mentioned by Cowichan Valley Citizen
item.description:
Federal NDP leader gets down to grass (and other) roots in Cowichan
Flanked by Nanaimo-Cowichan MP Jean Crowder and Cowichan Green Community's Judy Stafford, the Mulcairs marveled at how well everything was growing in the fledgling urban farm. The downpour the previous night at least made everything look its best ...

item.title: Mentioned by Nunatsiaq News
item.description:
Indigenous peoples day a time “to reflect,” says NDP aboriginal affairs critic
9, should see all Canadians reflecting “on the commitments made that helped create the modern country where we all share the land,” said Jean Crowder, the New Democratic Party's MP for Nanaimo-Cowichan and her party's aboriginal affairs critic, in an ...

item.title: Mentioned by Victoria Times Colonist
item.description:
BC aboriginal schools need boost, report says
The report was requested by NDP aboriginal affairs critic and Nanaimo-Cowichan MP Jean Crowder as a followup to a 2009 report that showed more than 500 reserve schools in Canada are under-funded. On Thursday, Crowder said the gap in funding stems ...
